required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real Life Second-Line Nivolumab in Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Real Life Second-Line Nivolumab in Advanced Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer: a French Observational Multicenter Study of 259 Patients (ABCT-IMMUNOBZH)

brief_summary.textblock: Data regarding nivolumab as second line treatment in advanced non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) are based on selected populations and might not reflect daily practice. Investigators aimed at assessing efficacy and safety of nivolumab in a real-life setting and determining a subtype of NSCLC patients that are more likely to benefit from immunotherapy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Objective response rate evaluated by RECIST 1.1

study_pop.textblock: Advanced stage non-small cell lung cancer patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- advanced NSCLC (stage IIIB-IV)
- failure of at least one line of chemotherapy.
- age ≥18 years,
- initiation of nivolumab between 01/09/2015 and 30/09/2016.
Exclusion Criteria:
- nivolumab initiation after October 2016
- prior involvement in an immunotherapy trial
- refusal to participate.
